column5: Hi all, Finally broke the 30" mark on Lac Seul this morning. I have had countless fish over 30" but never one larger than 28" on Lac Seul. It was windier than **** out there today....but the walleye loved it and the graph was lit up in 22'FOW. Some of the fish we kept still only had fish fly in their guts....but a couple had 5" - 6" half digested bait fish, safe to say the bite was ON today, even if it did shut down a bit before we left around 1pm. Jigs and minnows (big minnows) had the numbers, but the bigger ones smashed leeches half way up the water column before the jig could get down there....great fun watching a gigantic signal race up to hammer your bait.http://i263.photobucket.com/albums/i...l/IMG_5577.jpg
Congrats on your 30incher! Fishing the NW end of Lac Seul in the spring, I have had a 30 pincher, and a couple of 29.5 inch walleyes! Big lakes usually means big fish!?
That's awesome, I don't know if I'll ever break the 30 mark up there. Seems like 28+ is like a boone and crocket deer, takes something special.
Great fish Simon.......wish I was fishing up there right now
